sen.j: 平安時代以後の慣例として、退位する天皇が譲位の宣命を宣布する儀式とその後に行われる継承者（新帝）への剣璽を引き渡す儀式（剣璽渡御の儀）の2つを中心として儀式体系が組まれてきた。
sen.e: As a custom after the Heian Period, a system of ceremonies developed centering around two rituals, the ceremony in which the emperor, who is abdicating his throne, proclaims the imperial edict of abdication, followed by the ceremony in which Kenji (the Sacred Sword and the Sacred Jewel) is passed down to the successor (the new emperor) (ceremony to transfer Kenji).

Following the Heian Period, a system of ceremonies centered on two rituals, one in which the abdicating emperor issued an edict proclaming his abdication, and the other in which the Kenji (the Sacred Sword and the Sacred Jewel) were passed down to the successor (the new emperor) became customary.

sen.j: 明治時代に制定された皇室典範において皇位継承は天皇の崩御（死亡）を前提としているため、現行法では生前退位は出来ないと解釈されている（明治の皇室典範制定時に皇位継承を崩御時に限定したのは、天皇と政府が対立した時に天皇が退位をもって政府を圧迫するのを防ぐ意図もあったとされている。また、第二次世界大戦後に昭和天皇が退位を検討したとも言われているが、内外の反対で立ち消えとなった）。
sen.e: According to the Imperial House Act established during the Meiji Period, succession to the Imperial Throne presumes the death of the Emperor, and therefore, it is interpreted under the existing law that abdication of the throne is not possible while an emperor is still alive (it is said, when the Imperial House Act was established, that the reason for limiting succession to the Imperial Throne to the occasion of Emperor's death was because there was an intention to prevent the Emperor from abdicating his throne and thereby pressuring the government in case there was a confrontation between the Emperor and the government. Also, after World War II, it is said that Emperor Showa considered abdicating his throne, but because of oppositions within and from the outside this issue faded away).

sen.j: これについて、先例の存在や天皇の自由意思を尊重するべきであることを理由として生前の退位を容認すべきとの意見もあるが、退位後の天皇の処遇（財政的、政治的位置付けの問題。特に後者は院政の問題）や皇位継承の複雑化及び後継者の不足による皇統断絶の可能性などの点から反対の意見が強い。
sen.e: Regarding this, on the basis of respect for the Emperor's free will as well as the existence of former examples, there are views that say that abdication of the throne before death should be allowed, but there are strong opposing views because of the issues of how the Emperor should be treated after his abdication (financial matter and issues on his position in the political administration. The latter, in particular, is a problem of political administration by the retired emperor), complications in the succession to the Imperial Throne, and the possibility of the extinction of the Imperial Line due to a lack of successor.
